entry.title: Future of the bitcoin-dev mailing list
entry.summary: The communication emphasizes the necessity for the bitcoin-dev mailing list to maintain its independence from Bitcoin Core. It highlights the importance of cryptographic signatures, which are inherently supported by mailing lists and not by platforms like GitHub. These signatures include both PGP and DKIM, which are crucial for ensuring the authenticity of messages. The message asserts that GitHub and similar web forums provide an inferior user experience compared to mailing lists, particularly because they require a stable internet connection and don't support asynchronous, offline responses. For further details on these views, one can refer to the author's personal website at https://petertodd.org or reach out via email.
